thread.title: Thierry Henry stars in Texas music video...but why?
thread.title_full: Thierry Henry stars in Texas music video...but why? | Daily Mail Online

author: Matt Garrett For Mailonline
title: Thierry Henry stars in Texas music video...but why?
text:
Thierry Henry has starred in a new music video for Scottish rock band Texas but doesn't get a chance to sing with Sharleen Spiteri.
The former Arsenal footballer ferries Spiteri around in a Porsche Carrera and talks to her in the background of the band's new single 'Let's Work It Out'.
The pair's relationship goes way back together and Henry even dedicated an Arsenal goal to Spiteri's newborn daughter.
Thierry Henry ferries friend Sharleen Spiteri around in a Porsche Carrera under streetlights
Spiteri and Henry smile together in an Instagram photograph after Henry landed a job at Sky
Thierry Henry (left) dedicating his winner to his friend's new born daughter Misty Kyd Heath in 2002. Henry scoring vs Spurs in 2004 on his way to earning the Golden Boot with 25 goals
Henry celebrated his winner against Manchester City back in 2002 by revealing a T-shirt with the message 'For the new born Kyd', after Spiteri had just given birth to her daughter Misty Kyd Heath earlier that day.
Henry has appeared on our screen without his boots before, appearing in adverts for Renault, where he had Britain repeating ' va-va-voom' ; Nike, where he featured in the secret tournament advertisement alongside Ronaldinho and Patrick Vieira; Gillette, where Henry was named as one of the three ambassadors alongside Roger Federer and Tiger Woods; and he has also had deals with Pepsi and Beats.
World Cup winner Henry now works as a pundit for Sky and as a coach for the Belgium national side.
Spiteri smiles alongside Henry in the Porsche Carrera as they cruise around at night
Thierry and Sharleen talk in between clips of Sharleen's unorthodox dancing (below)
The Scottish Spiteri dances in front of a green screen featuring a POV view of a car journey
Henry joins former footballers Djibril Cisse and Royston Drenthe in the music industry this week, following Cisse's announcement that he was retiring to pursue a career as a DJ and Drenthe released a rap song after failing to find a new club.
Texas reached number one in the UK album charts in 1997 with White on Blonde, which to date has been certified six-times platinum in the UK.
Say What You Want, a single from the White on Blonde album, has over six million views on Youtube.
Let’s Work It Out is a single from Texas’s new album, Jump On Board, which is their first new material for four years.
Jump on Board is released April 21 and will be the band's ninth album.
